arts.ttl: Arsenal sent Liam Delap transfer message as new Alexander Isak alternative mooted
arts.sum: Arsenal legend Ray Parlour tells Sports Mole why Liam Delap would be an ideal signing for the Gunners after his 11th goal of the Premier League season.

arts.ttl: Wolves fight back to beat Ipswich in key relegation match
arts.sum: Pablo Sarabia came off the bench to orchestrate a 2-1 comeback win for Wolverhampton Wanderers against Ipswich Town at Portman Road, taking them 12 points clear of their opponents and the relegation zone. Ipswich looked set to close the gap on 17th-placed Wolves to just six points when Liam Delap gave them the lead in the first half.
Ipswich are teetering on the brink. With seven games remaining and 12 points adrift of safety, their relegation battle looks over.

arts.ttl: Vitor Pereira likes what he sees as Wolves hit back to seal a big win at Ipswich
arts.sum: Wanderers are 12 points above the Suffolk side following the success at Portman Road.

arts.ttl: Wolves come from behind to inflict a damaging defeat on Ipswich
arts.sum: The Suffolk side now trail their 17th-placed opponents by 12 points.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace v Brighton, West Ham v Bournemouth and more: football â€“ live
arts.sum: Updates from the Premier League and beyond Live scoreboard | Read Football Daily | Mail Dominic Meanwhile, the top of League Two is madness. Port Vale are on the brink of a 3-2 win at Walsall that would take them to the summit, leapfrogging the hosts, while Doncaster conjured up two goals in the final few minutes at Cheltenham to win 2-0 and boost their hopes of automatic promotion. Full time: Luton 1-1 Leeds, Coventry 1-2 Burnley. Sunderland still lead with a couple of minutes to go at The Hawthorns. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: How to watch Ipswich vs Wolves
arts.sum: Live text coverage of Ipswich vs Wolves is also being provided on Saturday afternoon as wolves.co.uk returns with the Matchday Blog, beginning two hours ahead of kick-off. Audio coverage of the pre-match build-up, full 90 minutes and post-match reaction of Ipswich vs Wolves is available via Wolves TV and the Wolves App.
